mod09.exercise5.banking.domain

类 Customer

  • java.lang.Object
    • mod09.exercise5.banking.domain.Customer
  • 所有已实现的接口:
    java.lang.Comparable<Customer>

    public class Customer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Customer>
    Storage the details of each customer.
    从以下版本开始:
    2019/9/5
    作者:
    paulzhn

    • 构造器概要

      构造器 
      构造器和说明
      Customer(java.lang.String f, java.lang.String l)
      Initialize the account list and set the customer's name.

    • 方法概要

      所有方法 实例方法 具体方法 
      限定符和类型 方法和说明
      void addAccount(Account account)
      Add an account for the customer.
      int compareTo(Customer o)
      Compare two customers in a lexigraphical order with the last name taking precedence over the first name.For example, "Joe Smith" should come before "Samuel Smith".

      java.util.Iterator getAccounts()

      • Customer

        public Customer(java.lang.String f,
                java.lang.String l)
        Initialize the account list and set the customer's name.
        参数:
        f - first name of the customer
        l - last name of the customer

        public void addAccount(Account account)

      • setAccount

        public void setAccount(Account account,
                       int index)
        Set the account by the specific account.
        参数:

        index - the index of which account should be set

      • getNumOfAccounts

        public int getNumOfAccounts()
        返回:
        the number of account belonging this customer.

      • getAccounts

        public java.util.Iterator getAccounts()
        返回:
        an iterator to the list account.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Customer o)
        Compare two customers in a lexigraphical order with the last name taking precedence over the first name.For example, "Joe Smith" should come before "Samuel Smith".
        指定者:
        compareTo 在接口中 java.lang.Comparable<Customer>
        参数:
        o - the Customer object to be compared
        返回:
        the difference between the first not-equal-to letter. If equal, return 0; if the param is smaller, return a positive number; conversely return a negative number.
